page.title: 07Farming around Bridport
page.content: Outside the built-up areas of Bridport and West Bay most of the countryside is farmland. Dairy farming is the predominant type of farming and so most fields are intensively managed for pasture. Less accessible areas and steep slopes are mainly used for rough grazing by horses as well as sheep and cattle. Most of the horses are used for horse riding especially for holiday makers in the summer. Some of the larger fields are used for arable crops, but most of the fields are quite small and irregularly shaped with little evidence of hedge removal. The fields along the cliff-tops are gradually getting smaller as erosion causes the cliffs to slip.
